sentences.sContent: The eggs take three days to hatch.
sentences.sCn: 这些蛋要三天时间才能孵化。

sentences.sContent: He stuck his head up through the hatch.

phrases.pCn: 格子信号，交叉影线；网纹网状线剖面线，网纹网状线

words.tran: 人工孵化的鱼苗或小鸟
孵化；策划（hatch的过去分词形式）
[禽] 孵化；给…加影线；策划（hatch的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out
A hatch is an opening in the deck of a ship, through which people or cargo can go. You can also refer to the door of this opening as a hatch.
